page.title: 11Appleby Fire Station
page.content: Appleby fire station is in Holme Street.In the fire station yard there is a big white tower shaped like a letter T with hooks on.That is used to clean the hoses out. They have two fire engines and a van.At Appleby the sub officer is Mr.David Richardson and there are twelve retained fire men.That means they don't work there all the time.They just carry bleepers.When the bleeper goes all the fire men hurry to the fire station.Fire station night is on Monday when they have meetings,check the equipment and train.The next nearest fire stations are at Shap,Kirkby Stephen and Penrith.Fire men also go to road accidents,and floods.But most of the things are fires. Wayne Birkbeck
